Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Hydro-Pepper’ offers a bold, clean, and pungent flavour profile: an initial sharp, peppery kick reminiscent of radish, followed by a fresh, green, and slightly tangy finish. Its leaves are small, round, and dark green, growing on succulent, hollow stems that are exceptionally crisp and juicy. The entire plant forms a low, spreading mat of vibrant, glossy greenery.

2. The Crisp, Peppery Accent This watercress’s intense flavour and refreshing crunch make it a powerful culinary accent.

  • Salad Spark: A small handful will electrify a green salad, potato salad, or grain bowl with its pungent spice. It pairs brilliantly with sweet and rich ingredients like oranges, beets, and goat cheese.
  • Sandwich & Taco Topper: The crisp stems and spicy leaves add a fantastic textural and flavourful crunch to sandwiches, burgers, and tacos, cutting through richness with its clean heat.
  • Signature Soups: It is the essential, non-negotiable ingredient for a classic, creamy watercress soup, where its peppery flavour mellows into a deep, complex warmth.
  • Garnish with a Kick: Use as a vibrant, edible garnish on soups, deviled eggs, or grilled fish to add a burst of fresh pepperiness.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Hydro-Pepper’ is a prolific cut-and-come-again variety. Harvest by snipping stems 3-5 cm above the base, using the “haircut” method. It will rapidly produce new shoots from the leaf nodes below the cut. Supplied as an RFID seed pad designed for a self-watering reservoir, it provides a rapid and abundant yield of 40–60g of crisp stems and leaves per week, thriving in the consistently moist conditions it loves.
